review_title: Large company with opportunities if persistent and in focus of senior management
employee_history: I worked at Credit Suisse full-time for more than 10 years
employeer_pros: Large sample size of different jobs and career paths; ability to mobilize internally for international experience; most of the employee base is easy to work and partner with; salary is commensurate with the job requirements in the industry.
employeer_cons: Inability to push across big ideas in an organized fashion due to layers of organizational red tape; constant change of leadership at top levels leads to abandoned ideas and in flight projects making in tough to deliver; focus still on high cost location staff and lower cost location staff is forgotten.

review_title: Great opportunities to grow a career
employee_history: I worked at Société Générale full-time for more than 10 years
employeer_pros: Career advancement and internal / international mobility, benefits, wide variety of businesses within the Corporate & Investment Bank
employeer_cons: As in most large FI organizations, approval processes can take quite some time

employee_history: I worked at Société Générale full-time for more than 3 years
employeer_pros: Smart and hardworking worker bees. Interesting deals. Try to be creative. Structured finance-focused. Good benefits, was an early adopter of 1 day a week WFH, casual dress.  More life balance, at 50-65 hrs/week.
employeer_cons: A lot of overseas armchair quarterbacking in US markets they are not experts in. Many at the top of the house in CIB seem ill-equipped to run businesses - good individual contributors but shouldn't be the stewards. Often felt like they threw ideas at a wall to see what stuck rather than taking time to do white papers. From a competitive standpoint, they copy what BNP, Credit Ag and Natixis do, rather than other better performing IBs. Cannot compete on cost of funds vs many competitors in the US so have to take on more aggressive businesses.

employee_history: I have been working at Société Générale full-time for more than a year
employeer_pros: Company environment, and work cultur
employeer_cons: No cons as such required to mention

review_title: Good to learn and as a quick career step
employee_history: I have been working at Société Générale full-time for more than 10 years
employeer_pros:
Flexibility.
Paid time off above average.
Easy to outperform compared to other banks in NY.
Good to learn. They bring some strong technical guys from Paris.
employeer_cons:
Pays with a discount compared to the NY market and therefore attracts low local calibres or very political guys. The bank survives in NYC with expats they bring from Paris at a lower cost.
Support functions are very political. Most of talent ends up leaving due to low evolution perspectives
